laboratory_examinations.findings: A novel, heterozygous 3-kilobase deletion removing exons 7-9 of TP53 in the patient’s normal skin DNA; this deletion was homozygous in the leukemia DNA due to uniparental disomy. A total of 28 validated somatic single-nucleotide variations or indels in coding genes, 8 somatic structural variants, and 12 somatic copy number alterations were detected in the patient’s leukemia genome.
Except for the deleted region (exons 7-9), TP53 mRNA expression was similar to or higher than that observed in AML without TP53 mutations.
Revealed several complex chromosomal rearrangements in the leukemia genome, including monosomy 7, del(5q), and multiple translocations.
